    <title>Ajmal Masroor:  Deafening Silence and the Intolerable Hypocrisy by Liberals and Intellectuals</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ajmal-masroor/deafening-silence-and-int_b_9901504.html" />

        <name>Ajmal Masroor</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/ajmal-masroor/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        I'm becoming impassive to the inconsistent and selective mantra chanting of Western liberals calling for human rights, rule of law and democracy.  They seem to be quick to condemn human rights abuse in certain situations but in others, especially those involving Muslims, they remain curiously silent.

    <title>Angeli Bhandal:  The Media Needs to Bring People Together in the Face of Terrorism, Not Drive Them Apart</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/brussels_b_9615438.html" />
        <id>http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/brussels_b_9615438.html</id>
    
    <published>2016-04-05T06:20:16Z</published>
    <updated>2016-04-05T09:43:00Z</updated>
    
    <author>
        <name>Angeli Bhandal</name>
        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/angie/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        Instead of worrying about the spread of ISIS, we need more uplifting spirits. We must remember that we are the majority. Individually we may not be able to do a lot, but collectively we have the power to make a difference. It is up to us to filter through the sea of fear-mongering and ignorance and make a stand for the oppressed, regardless of race or gender.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/islamophobia">Islamophobia</a>, <a href="/tag/terrorism">Terrorism</a>, <a href="/tag/brussels">Brussels</a>, <a href="/tag/lahore">Lahore</a>, <a href="/tag/muslims">Muslims</a>, <a href="/tag/social-media">Social Media</a>, <a href="/tag/media">Media</a>,  <a href="/uk-universities-education">UK Universities & Education News</a></p>

		        We can't let terror win - the common refrain in the aftermath of the now all too frequent terror attacks. But ISIS is already winning. There's no shame in admitting because the terrorists have effectively rigged the game, in two important and connected ways.

    <title>Aldwyn Cooper:  Young Death, Selfish Politics and Terror Strike the Heart of Europe</title>
            <link rel="alternate" type="text/html" href="http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/aldwyn-cooper/brussels-attacks_b_9583716.html" />

        <uri>http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/aldwyn-cooper/</uri>
    </author>
    <content type="html" xml:lang="en-US" xml:base="http://huffingtonpost.co.uk/">
		        In the last half of March 2016, three separate but interrelated events have served to heighten concerns about the European venture: The deaths of young people studying in Spain, the self-serving behaviour of some British politicians, and the horror of the recent terrorist attacks in Brussels.
        	    <p>Read more: <a href="/tag/aldwyn-cooper">Aldwyn Cooper</a>, <a href="/tag/regents-university-london">Regent&#039;s University London</a>, <a href="/tag/eu-referendum">EU Referendum</a>, <a href="/tag/europe">Europe</a>, <a href="/tag/erasmus">Erasmus</a>, <a href="/tag/fallas-festival">Fallas Festival</a>, <a href="/tag/terrorism">Terrorism</a>, <a href="/tag/brussels">Brussels</a>, <a href="/tag/cbi">Cbi</a>, <a href="/tag/migration-crisis">Migration Crisis</a>, <a href="/tag/zaventem-airport">Zaventem Airport</a>, <a href="/tag/maelbeek-metro">Maelbeek Metro</a>, <a href="/tag/brexit">Brexit</a>, <a href="/tag/universities">Universities</a>, <a href="/tag/students">Students</a>,  <a href="/uk">UK News</a></p>

    <title>Martin McNamara:  Don't Forget Lessons of Guildford Four In War on Terror</title>
